sentence: Mr. THANEDAR. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 89 and YEA on Roll Call No. 90.

Ms. BONAMICI. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to attend today's vote  series. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No.  191, YEA on Roll Call No. 192, and YEA on Roll Call No. 193.                             personal explanation
Ms. CRAIG. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 159.

…Invoke  Cloture: Motion to Proceed to S. 2882), a bill making continuing  appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2026, and for  other purposes, I would have voted yea.

For rollcall vote No. 545, On the Cloture Motion (Motion to Invoke  Cloture: Motion to Proceed to H.R. 5371), a bill making continuing  appropriations and extensions for…
Mr. SOTO. Mr. Speaker, during Roll Call No. 166 on S. 331, I  mistakenly recorded my vote as NAY when I should have voted YEA.

Ms. GARCIA of Texas. Mr. Speaker, due to illness, I was unable to  vote during the vote series. Had I been able to vote, I would have  voted YEA on the Motion to Recommit H.R. 3668 and NAY on H.R. 3668,  Improving Interagency Coordination for Pipeline Reviews Act.                             personal explanation

Mr. CUELLAR. Mr. Speaker, I was unable to vote today due to adverse  weather delaying my flight to Washington, D.C. Had I been present, I  would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 240 and YEA on Roll Call No. 241.

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 306 and 307. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 306 and YEA on Roll Call No. 307.                             personal explanation

Mr. BELL. Mr. Speaker, I was absent during the time of votes today  due to minor health concerns. Had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 306 and YEA on Roll Call No. 307.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION

Mr. GOMEZ. Madam Speaker, I was not recorded on Roll Call Nos. 152,  153, 154 and 155 today. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 152, NAY on Roll Call No. 153, YEA on Roll Call No. 154,  and NAY on Roll Call No. 155.                             personal explanation

Mr. COURTNEY. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the chamber today. Had I  recorded my vote, I would have voted Yea on Roll Call No. 335, on the  motion to suspend the rules and pass S. 284, and Yea on Roll Call No.  336, on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 3187.

Ms. TITUS. Madam Speaker, I was absent from the floor and the missed  Roll Call votes numbered 263 and 264. Had I been present, I would have  voted: YEA on Roll Call No. 263 on the Motion to Instruct Conferees on  HR 3944, and NAY on Roll Call No. 264 on Final Passage HR 3486.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Ms. GILLEN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 146 and YEA on Roll Call No. 147.

Ms. TITUS. Mr. Speaker, I was absent from the floor and missed Roll  Call Nos. 57 and 58. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll  Call No. 57, H.R. 6644--Housing for the 21st Century Act, as amended  and YEA on Roll Call No. 58, H.R. 1531--PROTECT Taiwan Act, as amended.…

Mr. LARSON of Connecticut. Mr. Speaker, due to unforeseen  circumstances, I regrettably missed votes today. Had I been present, I  would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 125, NAY on Roll Call No. 126,  and NO on Roll Call No. 127.

Mr. WILLIAMS of Texas. Mr. Speaker, due to an official engagement, I  was unable to vote on H.R. 2965, H.R. 4305, and H.R. 1005. Had I been  present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 310, YEA on Roll Call  No. 311, and YEA on Roll Call No. 312.
Mr. FITZPATRICK. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 128.
Mr. HUIZENGA. Madam Speaker, I was delayed on the way to the floor  and missed the vote. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll  Call No. 32.

Mr. GRAVES. Mr. Speaker, I missed a series of votes today. Had I been  present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 183 and YEA on Roll  Call No. 184.                             Personal Explanation

Mr. LANGWORTHY. Mr. Speaker, I was not present due to unforeseen  personal circumstance. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 49 and YEA on Roll Call No. 50.                             personal explanation
Mr. McCORMICK. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 335.

Ms. STEFANIK. Mr. Speaker, I was absent for votes today. Had I been  present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 34, AYE on Roll Call  No. 35, NAY on Roll Call No. 36, YEA on Roll Call No. 37, and YEA on  Roll Call No. 38.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. BRECHEEN. Mr. Speaker, I was was unavoidably detained due to  illness and was not able to cast my vote on Roll Call No. 185. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 185.

Mr. WOMACK. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably absent and unable to vote.  Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 303 and YEA  on Roll Call No. 304.                             PERSONAL EXPLANATION
Mr. WESTERMAN. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 299.

…Mr. Speaker, due to increased traffic on  Independence Ave. and inclement weather, I was unable to be present for  the vote on H.R. 4922. Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on  Roll Call No. 270.
Mr. MACKENZIE. Madam Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted  YEA on Roll Call No. 32.
Mr. SMITH of Nebraska. Mr. Speaker, I was unavoidably detained. Had I  been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 299.

Mr. GRAVES. Mr. Speaker, I missed a series of votes.

Had I been present, I would have voted YEA on Roll Call No. 286, YEA  on Roll Call No. 287, and NAY on Roll Call No. 288.                             personal explanation
Mr. MEUSER. Mr. Speaker, had I been present, I would have voted YEA  on Roll Call No. 322.
